ReviewText:
I have been using this product plus the advance eye night repair since I was in my late teens and worked for B.C. Tell.  Back when we used baby oil to tan, I was always thin and even in my late teens had the beginnings of wrinkles around my eyes, to much time at the summer cabin and at the beach without any sun protection, in later years a tanning bed for an hour was nothing.  My grandmother came from Norway above the Artic Circle and had so many criss-cross wrinkles she, I hate to say, looked like one of those shrunken apple heads that used to be popular.  Needless to say I had reason to worry.  These products were very expensive in Vancouver, B.C. I don't remember if they had the eye serum that early and the Advanced Night repair I am sure didn't have the longer name, I can't remember when it changed, who notices the bottles are still 
the same, but I think the price was still back in the late 60's around $80.00 CDN as every chance I got I would drive down to Seatle and buy it I believe it was about $20.00 less down there.  I could be wrong as I was only making approx $180.00 with all the overtime I could get every two weeks at B.C. Tell.  Maybe you could check that,  I only worked there for 2 years, Of course if I'm wrong I can blame it on forgetfulness now.  Well I still think the product is great Oh I've strayed away a few times, there are of course those miracle things on T.V. and I've never accepted my wrinkles, I've fought them all the way, I do admit to the odd fillers.  But in the end I'm still thin, less than I was as a teenager, I don't have joules, I don't have a turkey neck, my cheek bones are still well in place no slipping skin, don't need any eye work, the jaw is still there.  I do have wrinkles, nothing like I was expecting, they are still round my eyes and of course deeper, laugh lines, and lines thru my cheeks, definitely more than my friends with more meat on them.  I believe those little brown bottles have certainly helped keep me young.  As they say "you are as young as you feel"  I feel young and always have.  My life as for most, has had it's hills and mountains to climb, I believe we are here to win at life, not give up.  If a little jar of face cream regardless of what brand makes you think it's helping and a touch of make-up, don't get lazy and forget the make-up, a touch of mascara, a little lipstick, does wonders.  I got lazy I quit wearing any face make-up, you know I'm old enough not to worry (and I still work what was I thinking) I went to a function, took me 15 min. or less to throw on the face make-up the under eye liner, mascara, eye brows, a touch of blush and lips, I got so many compliments I won't go out without my face again...Just make it discreet, we're not going out to a New Years Party.  We Older Gals, need reminding from people like you Estee Lauder, we'er not old, we just get tired sometimes, or down in the dumps.  And to our good friends be honest and tell us when we are slipping, take us in to get that new face cream and make-up, we just may need that push, don't be shy, we need to help each other.
Cheers
